titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Thomas Worsham, Indictment
CWG5344

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Calloway Circuit Court
The commonwealth of Kentucky
against
Thomas Worsham

The Grand Jury of Calloway County in the name and by the authority of the commonwealth of Kentucky accuse Thomas Worsham of the crime of Murder committed as follows (viz) The Said Thomas Worsham on the 10th day of June 1865 in the county aforesaid did feloniously and with Malice aforethought kill and Murder Thomas Taylor by shooting him with a Pistol loaded with Powder and a Leaden Ball or other hard substance against the Peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

W W Tice
P T atty for
Comth 1st J D

Information by
R H Stubblefield
Mrs Jones Stubblefield
Samuel Stubblefield
Joseph Thurman
J. W. Whitworth

A copy attest Geo D C
for W Bowman clk
Commonwealth of Ky
vs } Murder
Thomas Worsham
